basics.name: Laura Wagner
basics.label: Doctoral Candidate
basics.summary: Researcher focused on revealing fault lines in visual culture through text-to-image generative-AI models. Focussed on the impact of open-source AI in the wild and model personalizations.

work.name: Universität Zürich
work.position: Doctoral Candidate Kunstgeschichte der Neuzeit | Digital Humanities
work.summary: Research on open-source text-to-image AI personalizations and their societal impact
highlights: Investigating toxicity in open-source text-to-image communities
Developing metrics for evaluating foundation model augmentations

work.name: KISD - International School of Design
work.summary: Development of teaching formats for AI in design education
highlights: Co-headed the school's 'Living-Objects-Lab' for embedded AI prototyping
Managed GPU-Cluster architecture for student use

work.name: KISD - International School of Design
work.summary: Creation of exercises using Machine Learning techniques
highlights: Developed Jupyter Notebooks for student accessibility

work.name: Radial Design
work.summary: UX/UI design for the automotive industry
highlights: Creating prototypes in the Unity Game Engine
Motion design and 3D assets using Blender and After Effects

work.name: Fraunhofer Institute for Production Technology (IPT)
work.summary: Design and Development of interactive trade fair exhibits

volunteer.summary: Providing care for adults with severe forms of autism

education.institution: KISD International School of Design, TH Köln
FH Aachen, Aachen University of Applied Sciences

awards.title: Kölner Design Preis (3rd place)
awards.summary: Awarded for Master Thesis Research and the resulting short film 'Borrowed Limbs'

certificates.name: Technical Safety Instruction (TSI)
certificates.summary: Certified to operate woodworking machinery under supervision

projects.name: Borrowed Limbs
projects.summary: Short film created using GAN, and text-to-image with diffusion models in collaboration with Lisa Marleen Mantel
highlights: Screened at several occasions including Ars Electronica
Supervised by Prof. Dr. Lasse Scherffig, Prof. Dr. Laura Popplow and Prof. Nina Juric
Won the Kölner Design Preis 2023 (3rd place)

projects.name: Animation in X-Reality
projects.summary: 2-weeks summer school employing projection mapping and text-to-image AI
highlights: Resulting installation projected onto Vilnius City Hall facade
